plugins.name: Nexus
plugins.description:
Nexus is a Figma plugin designed to seamlessly sync content from Google Sheets while automatically updating text layers and their names.


Built for designers and product teams, Nexus eliminates manual copy-pasting by connecting your Figma files to a centralized content source. Select a language, pick the texts you need, and apply them in one click ‚Äî layer names and content are updated instantly.


‚úÖ Real-time sync with Google Sheets

‚úÖ Automatic update of text layer content

‚úÖ Structured layer renaming (#BODY.x, #CTA.x)

Save time. Stay consistent. Focus on design.

Nexus handles the repetitive work ‚Äî you focus on creating.

plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ‚å®Ô∏è View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. üñåÔ∏è Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. üåÖ Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. üé® Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. üåê Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ‚úÖ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. üñºÔ∏è List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. üåÉ Dark mode support.

plugins.name: Zeytal Variables Extractor
plugins.description:
Zeytal helps developers extract and optimize SVGs, transform Figma styles and variables, and generate TailwindCSS config files effortlessly.


This plugin helps Zeytal users leverage their Figma variables.


Zeytal Features

  1. Extract and optimize SVGs
  2. Extract and convert Figma variables to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  3. Extract and convert Figma styles to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  4. Convert Figma styles and variables to TailwindCSS v4 config files.


This Plugin

This plugin helps Figma users prepare their Figma files for Figma variables extraction and code generation.


How it works :

  1. Start the plugin.
  2. Click on one button to export your Figma variables to Zeytal
  3. Use Zeytal CLI to generate your code and config files


Everything is explained in detail in Zeytal documentation.
plugins.tagline: From Figma to Code In One Command Line

plugins.name: Figma to osu!framework
plugins.description:
A third-party plugin to convert Figma elements to osu!framework code


Supported features:

  1. Basic layout (RelativeSizeAxes, Anchor/Orign, Padding, etc.)
  2. Converting cornerRadius to masking containers
  3. Linear Gradients (Both simple as well as multi-stop gradients work as long as they're horizontal or vertical)
  4. Text (Only one style per text element supported)

plugins.name: Badenova Design System Sync
plugins.description:
This plugin synchronizes your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System


Usage:

You need to provide a valid GitHub token to synchronize your Figma tokens.

To obtain a GitHub token, contact christoph.hummel@badenova.de or generate your own token.


If you have a valid GitHub token, enter it into the respective input field and press Save.

Then, click the Sync Badenova Design-Tokens button.

If the synchronization is successful, you will receive a confirmation message.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System

plugins.name: frameToGroup
plugins.description:
frameToGroup converts frames into organised groups while retaining essential visual properties.


‚ú® Key Features

‚úÖ Effortless Conversion ‚Äì Convert frames into neatly structured groups while keeping fills, strokes, and effects intact.

‚úÖ Nested Frame Handling ‚Äì Automatically processes nested frames for a well-organised layer structure.

‚úÖ Style Preservation ‚Äì Retains local styles and effects using asynchronous processing.

‚úÖ User-Friendly UI ‚Äì Simple, intuitive interface with one-click conversion.

‚úÖ Continuous Workflow ‚Äì Keep the plugin open for multiple conversions without interruptions.

  1. Select the frames you wish to convert in your Figma document.

Introduction

This Figma plugin allows users to convert raster images into scalable vector graphics with a single click. Enhance your design process by transforming pixel-based images into smooth, resolution-independent vectors directly within Figma.


Function Description

  1. Vectorizes selected image nodes into SVG format.
  2. Preserves image structure and generates editable vector paths.
  3. Outputs scalable vector graphics compatible with Figma‚Äôs design tools.


How to Use

  1. Select an image node on your Figma canvas.
  2. Click the ‚ÄúVectorize Image‚Äù button in the plugin UI.
  3. The plugin will generate an SVG vector output placed adjacent to the original image node.


Notes

  1. Ensure only one image node is selected before using the plugin.
  2. Only image nodes are supported for vectorization. Non-image nodes will not be processed.
  3. Large images may take additional time for processing.

plugins.name: ‰∏ÄÈîÆÁøªËØëÂÖÉÁ¥† Quick Translate
plugins.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

plugins.name: ÁîªÊùøjsonÂØºÂá∫(‰∏ì‰∏öÁâà) Export Frame JSON Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin is designed to help users export detailed JSON data of selected nodes, including auto layout information, Frame nesting relationships, text properties, and more. With this plugin, users can easily retrieve structured data from design elements, facilitating data analysis, secondary development, or documentation.


ÂäüËÉΩ

  1. Export complete JSON data of selected nodes, including properties like type, name, size, position, fills, strokes, and more.
  2. Support exporting text content, font name, font size, and other properties of text nodes.
  3. Support nested export of nodes such as Frame, Group, Component, and Instance, preserving the full hierarchical structure.
  4. Complete export of auto layout information, including layout mode, primary and secondary axis alignment, padding, and spacing.
  5. Safely serialized JSON data export ensures compatibility and completeness.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select one or more nodes from which you want to export data.
  2. Click the export button in the plugin, and the plugin will automatically extract all relevant information from the selected nodes and generate JSON data.
  3. The exported JSON data will be displayed in the plugin interface, allowing users to copy or download it for further use.


Notes

  1. This plugin currently supports exporting properties of common node types such as Frame.
  2. Ensure that the selected node types are supported by the plugin; otherwise, related data might not be exportable.
  3. If errors occur during the export process, check whether the nodes contain excessive nesting or complex properties. Simplify the structure if needed and try again.

plugins.name: ContentKit
plugins.description:
Design and prototype more efficiently with ContentKit

Use ContentKit as your central hub for all design content. Generate any kind of data with AI and sync your designs directly in Figma with one click. Collaborate seamlessly with your team like never before.


Try it in the playground file: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1500498135891868616


ü§ñ Generate content with AI: Bootstrap your prototypes with AI-generated datasets. Create realistic content for any scenario without having to start from scratch.


üéõÔ∏è Populate anything, not just text: Populate text, variant properties, component instances, and colors to update entire prototypes.


‚úèÔ∏è Create and edit directly in Figma: Build custom scenarios and edit data without leaving Figma. Define real-life situations and personas, then populate each screen exactly how you want it. No import roundtrips, no confusion about who has the latest data.


üîÑ Keep your prototypes synced: Large prototypes often mean duplicated screens. Sync changes across all screens at once, so you never miss updating that one text box in the corner.


üìÅ Stay organized with projects: Sort your content using projects and screens.


üë• Collaborate with team and clients: Share datasets with your team and clients so they can contribute content while you design. Apply their changes with one click when ready.


üöÄ Why ContentKit?

ContentKit provides better workflows, more seamless editing, and applies content more reliably than other tools. Variant properties, nested data and complex screens are no afterthought.


The ability to create and populate multiple columns allows working with detailed data and is perfectly suited for prototypes that need to be kept up to date across iterations.


üìä Additional Features

- Works seamlessly with nested screens and complex designs

- Import your existing data from CSV and Excel

- Built-in permissions and security controls


Learn more: intersectionslab.com/contentkit


Have feedback or ideas?

Contact me at kmueller@intersectionslab.com
plugins.tagline: Generate data with AI and populate text, properties, instances, and more‚Ä¶

plugins.name: Chartify
plugins.description:
Chartify is a powerful yet simple plugin that helps you turn spreadsheet data into clean, customizable charts ‚Äî directly in Figma.


Just upload a file or paste a public Google Sheets link, and Chartify will generate a beautiful chart that fits right into your design.


What Chartify can do:

  1. Supports data from:
  2. CSV, TSV, Excel (.xlsx/.xls)
  3. Google Sheets (public links)
  4. HTML tables, XML, Word (.docx), PDF, and more
  5. 6 chart types:
  6. Line
  7. Smooth Line
  8. Column
  9. Bar
  10. Pie
  11. Donut
  12. Smart customization options:
  13. Auto layout support
  14. Figma Variables for styles
  15. Optional axes, grid, and legends
  16. Responsive and consistent with your design system



How to use:

  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Upload a data file or paste a public Google Sheets URL.
  3. (Optional) Enter the sheet name.
  4. Choose the chart type.
  5. Adjust settings: auto layout, variables, axes, and legend.
  6. Click Generate ‚Äî your chart will appear directly on the canvas.


Chartify is built for designers who need to visualize data fast ‚Äî without leaving Figma.

plugins.name: Pinnaflow Collections
plugins.description:
Figma CMS Table Generator helps you structure CMS data directly in your Figma file, and export it as a Webflow-compatible CSV.


With this plugin, you can:


üóÇ Create CMS Collections

Define fields with types like Plain Text, Rich Text, Image, Number, Date, or Switch ‚Äî all directly in your Figma UI.


üß© Add CMS Items

Populate data using a form-driven interface. Each item becomes a variant within your CMS component.


üì§ Export CSV for Webflow

Download a ready-to-import CSV with your data structured according to Webflow CMS standards.


üéØ Apply CMS Data to Design

Inject field values into selected Figma elements by choosing collection, item, and field ‚Äî no copy-pasting.


‚ö° Real-Time Preview & Auto Validation

Live feedback lets you know when your component is ready for export, and disables the export button if any structure is invalid.


üñº Responsive & Intuitive UI

A clean and responsive layout, with tooltips, modals, and auto-tab interactions for seamless workflow.


üõ† How to use:

Create a Collection

Go to the "Create Collection" tab ‚Üí enter a collection name ‚Üí define fields ‚Üí click "Create Collection".


Add Items

Switch to "Create Item" ‚Üí fill in values for each defined field ‚Üí click "Create Item".


Export to CSV

Select the CMS component ‚Üí click "Export CSV" in the Collection tab.


Apply Data to UI

In "Apply Data" tab ‚Üí choose collection, item, and field ‚Üí select a text layer in your design ‚Üí click "Apply to Selected Element".


‚úÖ Best Practices

Your CMS component must contain a frame named ‚ÄúCMS Properties‚Äù, with text layers in the format:

Field Name | Field Type


When applying data, make sure the selected element is a single text node.


Only one CMS component should be selected at a time when creating items or exporting.


Use consistent field names and valid types for clean CSV output and Webflow compatibility.
plugins.tagline: Create CMS collections in Figma and export them for Webflow import

plugins.name: Harmony ‚Äì Snap Any Design to Your System Styles
plugins.description:
Clean up designs by applying styles and variables from your design system!


This plugin automatically snaps every color, text style, spacing, and radius in your design to the nearest matching style token from your design system.


Disclaimer: the design styles and variables should be present in the file


Whether you‚Äôre importing AI-generated UIs or working with inconsistent layouts, this tool ensures pixel-perfect alignment to your style guide.


It identifies and merges duplicate styles, normalizes paddings and spacings to a consistent grid and applies variables also to the spacing padding from your design system-keeping your file tidy, lightweight, and production-ready.

Perfect for design system maintainers, UI/UX designers, and teams working with handoff-ready components.


‚úÖ Matches colors using advanced perceptual comparison

‚úÖ Aligns font sizes and weights to existing text styles

‚úÖ Snaps corner radii and auto-layout spacing to your token grid

‚úÖ Cleans unused styles with detailed before/after stats

‚úÖ Works with selections or full-page scans


Please message any feedback or suggestion on sanjogbora@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Auto-apply your design system styles and variables to imported designs.

plugins.name: Pagify
plugins.description:
Pagify ‚Äî Page Management Made Simple


This plugin simplifies page management in Figma with an intuitive interface for creating, organizing, and maintaining your project structure. Whether you're building complex design systems or managing multiple screens, Pagify streamlines page workflows so you can focus on design.


No more cluttered page panels or tedious manual work. Just drag, drop, and structure your pages with precision.


Key features:

  1. Create pages from existing elements
  2. Quick page renaming and deletion
  3. Separator pages for better organization

Pagify ‚Äî Page Management Made Simple


This plugin simplifies page management in Figma with an intuitive interface for creating, organizing, and maintaining your project structure. Whether you're building complex design systems or managing multiple screens, Pagify streamlines page workflows so you can focus on design.


No more cluttered page panels or tedious manual work. Just drag, drop, and structure your pages with precision.


Key features:

  1. Create pages from existing elements
  2. Quick page renaming and deletion
  3. Separator pages for better organization
  4. Clean interface that stays out of your way
  5. Bulk operations for maximum efficiency

plugins.name: Color Combo
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin enables direct testing of color combinations in your design file. This allows the timeless color harmonies of Wada Sanz≈ç to be integrated into modern digital design processes without intermediate steps.


Steps

  1. Open the Color Combo plugin
  2. Select two color styles from the dropdown (or add new ones)
  3. Apply these color styles to your design elements (frames, text, etc.)
  4. Choose a color combination: Click any combination preview, or hit Random for instant variety Toggle Muted colors for subtle palettes

plugins.name: ui-palette-generator
plugins.description:
Supply a primary color and the plugin will generate accessible light and dark themed ui color palettes. Each palette includes:


Palette

  1. Primary
  2. Secondary (primary analogous, complementary, split compliment left, or split compliment right)
  3. Success
  4. Warn
  5. Error
  6. Info


Background

  1. z0
  2. z1
  3. z2
  4. z3
  5. z4
  6. z5


Palette hover

  1. Primary
  2. Secondary
  3. Success
  4. Warn
  5. Error
  6. Info


Text

  1. base (either #000 or #fff)
  2. light (base @ 75% opacity)
  3. lighter (base @ 50% opacity)
  4. lightest (base @ 33% opacity)


Text on palette

  1. textBaseOnPrimary
  2. textLightOnPrimary
  3. textLighterOnPrimary
  4. textLightestOnPrimary
  5. etc


Clicking "Add to document" will add both the light and dark themes as variable modes. If you're using the free plan, only the selected theme is added.


The plugin UI provides a live preview of the generated palettes in use.
plugins.tagline: Generate accessible light and dark themed ui color palettes
